result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew S Uick

records.addlTxt: State's Notice of Intent to introduce certified public records w/o extrinsic evidence
State's Notice of Intent to introduce 911 recordings
State's Notice of Intent to introduce Deft's statements

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim GMU (person, property, residence or family). No contact with the residence of 4218 Maryland Ave. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.

1:37 PM Defendant Andrew S Uick in court, in custody.  Attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski in court for Andrew S Uick.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Defense has filed a bond motion in case 22CM1061.
Defense is requesting that the cash bond be converted to a signature bond.
State will not object to a signature bond as long as there is no contact with the victim.
The victim does not object to allowing a third party to come and get the Deft's belongings.
BTC: Modify bond in case 22CM1061 to a $500 signature bond, all conditions remain, matters adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:29 AM Defendant Andrew S Uick in court, in custody.  Attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski in court for Andrew S Uick.  Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Defense indicates he has a conflict and needs to w/draw from one of the files and is moving to w/draw on all files.
State will defer to the Court.
BTC: Atty is allowed to w/draw on all files effective tomorrow, new SPD to be appointed.
Defense indicates they need a global offer in all the files.
State indicates Defense could see if the former client objects to counsel representing the deft.
Defense likes that idea.
BTC: Will w/draw the Order atty may w/draw, matters adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. 2:19 PM Defendant Andrew S Uick appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter appeared by video for Andrew S Uick.  Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, not guilty plea entered, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
